intro: Erycibe citriniflora, commonly known as the yellow-flowered erycibe, is a tropical plant native to Central and South America. It belongs to the Spermacetiaceae family and is characterized by its distinctive yellow flowers and smooth, waxy leaves. The plant produces a fragrant, yellowish latex that has been used traditionally in various applications. It thrives in humid, shady environments and is often found in lowland rainforests. Due to its ornamental value and unique properties, it is occasionally cultivated in botanical gardens and for its potential medicinal uses.
